020package com.bewsoftware.utils.io;
021
022import java.io.Closeable;
023import java.util.Scanner;
024
025/**
026 * Input interface description.
027 *
028 * @author <a href="mailto:bw.opensource@yahoo.com">Bradley Willcott</a>
029 *
030 * @since 1.0.7
031 * @version 1.0.7
032 */
033public interface Input extends Closeable, Exceptions {
034
035    /**
036     * Provides a configured {@link Scanner} object.
037     *
038     * @return new Scanner
039     */
040    public Scanner newScanner();
041
042    /**
043     * Reads a single line of text from the console.
044     *
045     * @return A string containing the line read from the console, not
046     *         including any line-termination characters, or null if an end of
047     *         stream has been reached.
048     */
049    public String readLine();
050
051    /**
052     * Provides a formatted prompt, then reads a single line of text from the
053     * console.
054     *
055     * @param fmt  A format string as described in Format string syntax.
056     * @param args Arguments referenced by the format specifiers in the format
057     *             string. If there are more arguments than format specifiers,
058     *             the extra arguments are ignored.
059     *
060     * @return A string containing the line read from the console, not including
061     *         any line-termination characters, or null if an end of stream has
062     *         been reached.
063     */
064    public String readLine(final String fmt, final Object... args);
065
066    /**
067     * Reads a password or passphrase from the console with echoing disabled.
068     *
069     * @return A character array containing the password or passphrase read from
070     *         the console, not including any line-termination characters, or
071     *         null if an end of stream has been reached.
072     */
073    public char[] readPassword();
074
075    /**
076     * Provides a formatted prompt, then reads a password or passphrase from
077     * the console with echoing disabled.
078     *
079     * @param fmt  A format string as described in Format string syntax for the
080     *             prompt text.
081     * @param args Arguments referenced by the format specifiers in the format
082     *             string. If there are more arguments than format specifiers,
083     *             the extra arguments are ignored.
084     *
085     * @return A character array containing the password or passphrase read from
086     *         the console, not including any line-termination characters, or
087     *         null if an end of stream has been reached.
088     */
089    public char[] readPassword(final String fmt, final Object... args);
090}
